snippet: The F.D.A. was right to suspend a leukemia drug while researchers try to identify which patients might be helped without serious risk of harm.
abstract: Editorial supports Food and Drug Administration's decision to suspend sales of Iclusig, promising leukemia drug that turned out to be unexpectedly dangerous; holds concerns about the decision disrupting treatment of patients who benefit from drug and can tolerate the side effects are unwarranted;  notes FDA has set up streamlined process for such patients to continue receiving treatment.
lead_paragraph: The F.D.A. was right to suspend a leukemia drug while researchers try to identify which patients might be helped without serious risk of harm.

headline.main: Approving, and Suspending, a Dangerous Drug
headline.print_headline: Approving, and Suspending, a Dangerous Drug
